description: From Latin truncus. Doublet of tronk and trunk.

entries.meaning: (medicine) The trunk (torso) of the human body or other animal body.
(medicine) An arterial trunk, such as the truncus arteriosus.

(geometry) A curve in the Cartesian plane consisting of all points (x,y) satisfying an equation of the form 
  
    
      
        f
        (
        x
        )
        =
        
          
            a
            
              (
              x
              +
              b
              
                )
                
                  2
                
              
            
          
        
        +
        c
      
    
    {\displaystyle f(x)={a \over (x+b)^{2}}+c}
  
 where a, b, and c are given constants.
